src_text: Bolwet i bja Coronavirus bja 2019 (COVID-19) ka Afrika Borwa
trg_text: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in South Africa

src_text: Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ditlamorago t a ditheri ano t e t eerwego ke Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa gotee le mekgatlo ya go fapafapana ya set haba se ipopilego, go netefat a gore kgatelopele ya naga ya go tloga maemong a bone goya maemong a boraro a go tswalelwa ga naga ka bophara e thekgwa ke dikgopolo t a bagwebi ani ka moka set haben
trg_text: Cabinet was briefed on the outcome of consultations undertaken by President Cyril Ramaphosa with various civil-society organisations, to ensure that the country s progression from Level 4 to Level 3 of the national lockdown has the support and inputs of all social partner Accompanied by various Ministers, he met with community, labour and business sectors, South African Council of Churches; leadership of interfaith communities; Mayors; Premiers; South African Local Government Association, traditional leadership and political parties represented in Parliamen

src_text: Ka go farafarwa ke Ditona t a go fapafapana, o kopane le set haha, ba omi le mafapha a kgwebo, Khansele ya Afrika Borwa ya Dikereke; baetapele ba ditumelo t a go fapafapana, Dimeyara; Ditonakgolo, Mokgatlo wa Afrika Borwa wa Pu oselegae, baetapele ba set o le mekgatlo ya dipolotiki ye emet wego ka Palamenten
trg_text: The COVID-19 NATJOINTS is built on work streams that comprise scientists; health specialists; engineers; representatives of the National Disaster Management centres; legal advisors; leadership of the country s security and law-enforcement agencies, and teams from departments that make up the economic and social clusters of the Forum of South African Directors-Genera NATJOINTS receives reports from different departments and submits proposals to Directors-General (DGs) to develop recommendations that are presented to the National Coronavirus Command Council (NCCC).

src_text: Kabinete e amoget e ditlamorago t a ditheri ano t e, t eo ka kakaret o di bego di agi a le go tlalelet a thulaganyo ya go fefolwa gannyane gannyane ga dikilet o goya maemong a boraro yeo e tla thomago ka la 1 Phupu 2020.
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the outcome of these consultations, which were broadly constructive and enriched planning for the gradual easing of restrictions to Level 3 which kicks in on the 1st June 2020.

src_text: Kabinete e gatelet e gape thekgo ya yona ya ditheri ano t a go akaret a bohle t e t eerwego ke Mopresidente Ramaphosa ga e sale go thoma seemo sa masetlapelo a boset haba ka la 15 Hlakola 2020.
trg_text: Cabinet reiterated its support for the inclusive consultations undertaken by President Ramaphosa since the start of the national state of disaster on 15 March 2020.

src_text: Ditheri ano t e di dirile gore go kgonagale mafapheng ka moka a set haba go kgatha tema twant hong ya leuba la COVID-19, go boloka maphelo le go
trg_text: These consultations have made it possible for all sectors of society to play a role in the fight against the Covid19 pandemic, saving of lives and protecting livelihood The operational and technical management of COVID-19 interventions is driven by the National Joint Operational and Intelligence Structure (NATJOINTS) and the Department of Healt NATJOINTS is a multidisciplinary coordinating structure of government that is activated to manage large project

src_text: Taolo ya ditiro le ya sethekniki ya magato a COVID-19 e sepedi wa ke Sehlongwa sa Boset haba sa Ditiro t a Mohlakanelwa t a Bohlodi (NATJOINTS) le Kgoro ya Maphel NATJOINTS ke sehlongwa sa tsamai o sa mafaphamant i sa mmu o seo se theilwego go laola diprot eke t a kgoparar
trg_text: Executive functions during Level 3 Cabinet approved that under Level 3, which starts from Monday, 1 June 2020, it would adopt a blended approach which includes both physical and virtual Cabinet meetingCabinet also approved the monitoring teams comprising Ministers and Deputy Minister They have been allocated to each of the 52 districts and metros to monitor the measures that have been put in place to combat the spread of COVID-19.AppointmentsAll appointments are subject to the verification of qualifications and the relevant clearance Council for Mineral Technology (MINTEK) Board: Dr Vanguard Mbuyiseli Mkosana (Chairperson);Ms Ntokozo Faith Ngcwabe

src_text: Sehlongwa sa NATJOINTS sa COVID-19 se theilwe godimo ga magoro a mo omo ao a arogant wego ka baent ineere, baemedi ba disenthara t a Boset haba t a Taolo ya Masetlapelo; baelet i ba semolao; baetapele ba dikemedi t a t hirelet ego ya naga le ba phethagat o ya molao, dihlopha go t wa dikgorong t eo di bopago makala a ikonomi le a leago a Foramo ya Afrika Borwa ya Balaodipharephar
trg_text: Hosting of Deep Space Ground Station Cabinet approved that the South African National Space Agency (SANSA) enter into a partnership with the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to host a Deep Space Ground Statio The station, which will be based in Matjiesfontein in the Western Cape, will support human spaceflight missions to the Moon, Mars and beyon

src_text: NATJOINTS e amogela dipego go t wa dikgorong t a go fapafafapana le go romela dit hi inyo go Balaodipharephare (di-DG) go hlama ditigelo t eo di hlagi et wago Lekgotlataelo la Boset haba ka ga Coronavirus (NCCC).
trg_text: The drastic containment measures resulted in significantly slowing and reduction of the infectious trajector The lockdown gave South Africa the time and space to put measures in place in the public and private health sectors to deal with an inevitable increase in infection.

src_text: NCCC e sekaseka dit hi inyo t a di-DG le go dira dit hi inyo t a yona Kabineteng fao dikakanyo, go akaret wa le melao, e dumelelwag Tshepedi o ye e netefat a gore Lekgotlaphethi i le t ea diphetho t a mohlakanelwa t eo di kwanet wego ke batho ka moka ebile di akaret a t ohl Ka gona, kabinete e sola ka bogale dit hi inyo t a maaka t a gore maloko a Lekgotlaphethi i o tee ka o tee ba nale seabe dit hi inyong t eo di t wago lekgotleng la NCCC goba diphethong t e t eerwego ke Kabinet.
trg_text: recommendations and also makes its own recommendations to Cabinet where proposals, including regulations, are approve This process ensures that the Executive takes collective decisions that are consensual and inclusiv Therefore, Cabinet condemns in the strongest possible terms false suggestions that individual members of the Executive are responsible for recommendations that emanate from the NCCC or decisions taken by Cabine.

src_text: Kabinete e dira boipilet o bja magato a go ipopa ka mafapha ka moka a set haba kgahlanong le lenaba la batho ka moka le kotsi, leuba la COVID-111.
trg_text: Cabinet appeals for the unity in action by all sectors of society against a common and dangerous enemy, the COVID-19 pandemi.

trg_text: Cabinet thanks all South Africans for their continuing sacrifice and understanding during the purposeful lockdown perio President Ramaphosa s declaration of the national state of disaster in terms of the Disaster Management Act, 2002 (Act 57 of 2002) immensely contributed to saving live .

src_text: Tsebagat o ya Mopresidente Ramaphosa ya seemo sa masetlapelo a boset haba goya ka Molao wa Taolo ya Masetlapelo, 2002 (Molao 57 wa 2002) e kgathile tema ye kgolo kudu go boloka maphel.
trg_text: Draft White Paper on Fire Services Cabinet approved the Draft White Paper on Fire Service The White Paper outlines key policy proposals that will form the basis of the fire services legislation that will replace the current Fire Brigade Services Act, 1987 (Act 99 of 1987).

src_text: Magato ao a tii eledit wego letsogo a taolo ya bolwet i a dirile gore bolwet i bjo bo nanye kudu le go fokot a tlhatlogo ya diphetel Go tswalelwa ga naga go file Afrika Borwa nako le sekgoba sa go hloma magato mafapheng a maphelo a mmu o le a praebete go swaragana le tlhatlogo ya go se laolege ya diphetel.
trg_text: It will be integrated into an existing network of three sites in the United States of America, Spain and Australi As the fourth site, it will complement the other three sites and provide improved coverage and redundancy for critical mission suppor SANSA will operate, maintain and manage the statio The station will benefit South Africa in, amongst others, the development of scarce skills and the growth of the science, engineering, technology and innovation secto It will also provide opportunities to feed the knowledge economy, and increase the national research output in space science and technolog 3.
